questions.question: How does JavaScript's prototypal inheritance differ from classical inheritance found in languages like Java or C++?

options.A: JavaScript uses classes and instances just like classical OOP languages
options.B: In JavaScript, objects inherit directly from other objects through a prototype chain, rather than from classes
options.C: JavaScript doesn't support inheritance at all
options.D: JavaScript's inheritance is statically typed while classical inheritance is dynamically typed
